title: Suggest the extra comma for 1-ary tuple when warning about unnecessary parentheses around type

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=b6faae0b3f3e40ccb0c2158eb481b989

```rust
pub type U8 = (u8);
```

The current output is (`1.52.1`, `1.53.0-beta.3` and `1.54.0-nightly`):

```
warning: unnecessary parentheses around type
 --> src/lib.rs:1:15
  |
1 | pub type U8 = (u8);
  |               ^^^^ help: remove these parentheses
  |
  = note: `#[warn(unused_parens)]` on by default

warning: 1 warning emitted
```

Ideally the output should look like:

```
warning: unnecessary parentheses around type
 --> src/lib.rs:1:15
  |
1 | pub type U8 = (u8);
  |               ^^^^ help: remove these parentheses
  |
  = note: `#[warn(unused_parens)]` on by default
  = note: if you meant to use 1-ary tuple, add an extra comma: `(T,)`
warning: 1 warning emitted
```

While I appreciate that using 1-ary tuple `(T,)` may seem odd in most cases it is still part of the language: [rust reference](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/reference/types/tuple.html). It is also something that the standard library leverages too (generalising trait implementations for 1-ary tuple). Providing this extra note could go a long way to help developers writing  generalised implementation of their Trait for n-ary tuples.
